title: Getting Vaccinated May Be Your Best Protection from Long COVID
description: According to a new study.

title: For University Leaders, Silence on the Israel-Hamas War Is Not Golden
description: The fear of alienating donors, students or faculty must not be confused with compassion or tolerance.

title: The Climate Impact of Your Thanksgiving Turkey vs. Holiday Travel
description: TIME introduces the 'Turkey Threshold': the point at which travel emissions exceed those of the meat you're eating.

title: Alt-Meat Companies Are Grappling With A Harsh Reality
description: At a meat-reduction conference in Denver, some people showed flagging spirits amid a year of bad news for the industry.

title: She Changed the Way Women Thought About Their Sexuality. Now She’s Finally Getting Her Due
description: The new doc 'The Disappearance of Shere Hite' tells the story of the feminist researcher who published a bestselling, groundbreaking work, then largely retreated from the public eye.

title: U.S.-Canada Border Crossing Closed After Vehicle Explosion on Bridge
description: The FBI's field office in Buffalo said in a statement that it was investigating the explosion on the Rainbow Bridge.

title: How Netflix’s Leave The World Behind Adaptation Differs From the Book
description: What to know about how Sam Esmail's Netflix movie compares to Rumaan Alam's 2020 novel.

title: Former U.S. Official Caught in Videos Racially Harassing a Halal Food Vendor
description: In online videos, Stuart Seldowitz can be seen harassing a food vendor on multiple occasions in Manhattan, and calling him a "terrorist."

title: The International Caviar Market Is Rife with Fraud
description: Fake or illegally harvested caviar is found in restaurants and stores across Europe.

title: Breaking Down Saltburn‘s Most Head-Turning Scenes With Director Emerald Fennell
description: The writer-director takes viewers inside the most memorable scenes in her new satirical thriller starring Barry Keoghan and Jacob Elordi.

title: About That R.E.M. Needle Drop in Maestro
description: Bradley Cooper's drama has some fun with a lyric about the movie's subject, Leonard Bernstein, in 'It's the End of the World as We Know It (And I Feel Fine).'

title: Inside TIME’s 1957 Cover Story on Leonard Bernstein
description: Bradley Cooper's new drama 'Maestro' depicts the iconic composer's career and complex marriage. Look inside TIME's 1957 cover story on Bernstein.

title: U.K. Museum Says Roman Emperor Was a Trans Woman
description: The museum has decided that it will now refer to Elagabalus, who ruled from 218 to 222 AD, with the pronouns she/her.

title: Here’s How Faithfully Maestro Captures Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre’s Story
description: Bradley Cooper and Carey Mulligan star as Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre. Here's how the movie compares to their real story.

title: The Cultural Politics Behind America’s Continuing Fascination With JFK
description: Key to understanding JFK's enduring impact is his cultural agenda.

title: New Data Shows a Global Surge in Searches Related to ‘Climate Anxiety’
description: Google searches related to “climate anxiety” are at a record high, the search giant said in an email to TIME.

title: The Race to Save Premature Babies in Gaza
description: Inside the rescue mission to save 31 critically ill babies from Gaza's Al-Shifa hospital.

title: 10 Thoughtful Gifts That Don’t Cost a Thing
description: From volunteering to a jar of affirmations, here are 10 thoughtful gifts that don't cost a thing.

title: Imprisoned Nobel Winner Narges Mohammadi Tells Angelina Jolie Iran’s People Will Prevail
description:
The Nobel Peace Prize winner talks
with Angelina Jolie about life in an Iranian prison, the roots of the protest movement, and what gives her hope.

title: U.K’s Conservative Government Pushes Tax Cuts in Hopes of Bolstering Electoral Chances
description: Britain's Conservative government sought to regain the political initiative Wednesday with tax cuts for businesses and individuals.

title: Sam Altman Returns as OpenAI CEO. Here’s How It Happened
description: Over five chaotic days, the world’s leading AI company appeared to be on the verge of imploding in a power struggle.

title: How Ridley Scott’s Napoleon Stacks Up Against the French Emperor’s Real Story
description: A Napoleon scholar breaks down where Ridley Scott's new movie, starring Joaquin Phoenix, hews close to history, and where it takes creative license.

title: The 10 Best Podcasts of 2023
description: From 'Classy' to 'The Retrievals,' see TIME's picks for the best podcasts of the year.

title: Napoleon Is a Big, Messy Pageant, With Joaquin Phoenix as Its Dad-Humor Emperor
description: Ridley Scott's historical epic is sometimes boring and pretentious and often a little silly, but there's still something compelling about it.

title: Key Moments From King Charles’ Speech at the State Banquet for South Korea
description: References to BTS, BLACKPINK, and 'Squid Game' were scattered throughout Charles’ welcome speech.

title: Millions of Kids Have Been Taken In by Relatives. Soon Those Families Could Get Paid
description: What to know about a new change to the foster care rules

title: Squid Game: The Challenge Proves That Nasty Reality TV Is Back With a Vengeance
description: The "nice" reality shows of the late 2010s have given way to a new generation of cutthroat competitions where cruelty reigns supreme.

title: Why We’re Still So Obsessed With Napoleon
description: David A. Bell explores the many sides of Napoleon, and how his story should remind us of the darkness that humans are capable of—not just the grand adventures.

title: Pope Francis Meets With Relatives of Israeli Hostages and Palestinian Prisoners
description: Pope Francis met separately Wednesday with relatives of Israeli hostages in Gaza and Palestinian prisoners in Israel and urged for peace.

title: OpenAI Says Sam Altman to Return as CEO With New Board Members
description: The company also said it will appoint new members to the board, which will be chaired by Bret Taylor and include Larry Summers and Adam D’Angelo.

title: Melissa Barrera, Susan Sarandon, and Others in Hollywood Lose Jobs, Representation Over Israel-Hamas War Comments
description: In recent weeks, those who have been most outspoken in support of Palestinians and against Israel’s military actions in Gaza have begun to be met with professional blowback.

title: Breaking Down the Debut Episodes of Fargo Season 5
description: Breaking down the first two episodes of the new season of FX's crime anthology series 'Fargo'

title: China Is Expanding Its Mosque Crackdown Beyond Xinjiang, Report Says
description: The Chinese government has expanded its campaign of closing mosques to regions other than Xinjiang, where for years it has been blamed for persecuting Muslim minorities, according to a Human Rights Watch report released Wednesday.

title: Israel Announces Tentative Deal With Hamas to Free Some Hostages, Pause Fighting
description: A tentative deal has been reached between Israel and Hamas to release at least 50 women and children hostages currently being held by Hamas in exchange for a brief pause in fighting and the release of an unspecified number of Palestinian prisoners.
